It is not always the best practice to directly use data of I( t) and R( t) in the estimation of the model parameters. The COVID‐19 projection by Gu ( https://covid19‐projections.com/) adopts a loss optimisation approach based on the SEIR model using only death counts due to quality concerns with infection counts (e.g. under‐reporting issue). The model uses a discrete state machine with probabilistic transitions to minimise a mixture of loss functions, such as mean squared error, absolute error and ratio error. In the literature, there are many other estimation procedures (e.g. Wallinga & Teunis, 2004; Cori et al., 2013; Thompson et al., 2019). Some of these alternatives do not estimate β and γ, but more directly target the effective reproductive number R
e ( t) in estimation and inference.
